attributes.additional_details:
Everyday is a more expensive day, for the motorist.

Fuel is never at a stable price, and it only keeps on rising, reaching rediculous prices in some parts of the country there are prices in the region of £1.40 for petrol and a staggering £1.65 for diesel.

Either a cap on fuel prices should be enforced or the tax hike reduced. The war on motorists should end, in times with costs rising, soon after people wont be able to afford their cars!
